meanings.definition: To divide a book or other text into chapters.
meanings.sent1: I chaptered my story to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The author chaptered the novel into different sections.
meanings.sent3: The textbook chaptered itself into tiny sections, making it look like a mini library.
meanings.sent4: Her mind chaptered the information like neatly stacked books on a shelf.
meanings.sent5: The teacher chaptered the lesson with colorful dividers to help students follow along.

meanings.definition: To be dismissed from the military with a less than honorable discharge.
meanings.sent1: He was chaptered out of the army due to misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was chaptered for violating military rules.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous recruit joked that he would be chaptered out for eating too many donuts.
meanings.sent4: Being chaptered from the military felt like being torn from a familiar book.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of being chaptered were as serious as losing a crucial page in a story.
